publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1273 Mr Brian Monteith: Daily Newspapers-That the Parliament regrets the decision of the Royal Mail to cease carrying small circulation newspapers by air, in particular, removing from newsagents supplies of The Morning Star, Britain's sole international socialist daily newspaper, and the Daily Jang, an Urdu daily paper serving, amongst others, Scotland's Muslim population; regards a diverse range of newspapers as being healthy for democracy, and urges the Royal Mail to reconsider its decision.
S2M-1273 Daily Newspapers (lodged on 5 May 2004) Mark Ballard*, Frances Curran*, Colin Fox*, Carolyn Leckie*

S2M-1273 Mr Brian Monteith: Daily Newspapers-That the Parliament regrets the decision of the Royal Mail to cease carrying small circulation newspapers by air, in particular, removing from newsagents supplies of The Morning Star, Britain's sole international socialist daily newspaper, and the Daily Jang, an Urdu daily paper serving, amongst others, Scotland's Muslim population; regards a diverse range of newspapers as being healthy for democracy, and urges the Royal Mail to reconsider its decision. Supported by: Mark Ballard, Frances Curran, Colin Fox, Carolyn Leckie, Susan Deacon*
S2M-1273 Daily Newspapers (lodged on 5 May 2004) Ms Sandra White*, John Swinburne*
S2M-1273 Daily Newspapers (lodged on 5 May 2004) Mr David Davidson*
S2M-1273 Daily Newspapers (lodged on 5 May 2004) Elaine Smith*
